availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas J. Williamson (caldwell co., ky, farm laborer and pvt)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Tennessee native. Son of Robert Williamson and Eliza Williamson. Married to Sarah J. Williamson. Father of C. K. Williamson. Student in Wilson County, Tennessee, in 1850. Farm laborer in Farmersville, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 48th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 26, 1863, to December 15, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Wilson County, District 14, p. 552A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Farmersville, p. 138.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Bucksnort, p. 410B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0447.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #246270.
